page.title: 10FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: The farms seem to be of two types, those that appear to have changed little over the last hundred years and those that have been bought by people originally from outside the area and modernised. The older farms are generally small, less than 100 acres and occupied by one or more elderly people while the others are larger, being a combination of land bought from a number of smaller farms. We saw evidence of natural fertilisation of the fields by the traditional 'muck spreader', flinging muck out as we passed.
